title: Multiprocessing
body_html:
Hi, I use the Pytorch on Windows, but I found a problem, when I use multiprocessing(cuda), I put all the codes in a file, it's no problem. When some arguments transfered by another difined file( or class in other file) ,it always has the problem:
ForkingPickler(file, protocol).dump(obj)
BrokenPipeError: [Errno 32] Broken pipeAnd

I found it's because some problems about Python multiprocessing on Windows, so can you give me some suggestions about this problem?

Thank you so much.

body:
Hi, I use the Pytorch on Windows, but I found a problem, when I use multiprocessing(cuda), I put all the codes in a file, it's no problem. When some arguments  transfered by another difined file( or class in other file) ,it always has the problem:    
       ForkingPickler(file, protocol).dump(obj)
       BrokenPipeError: [Errno 32] Broken pipeAnd 

I found it's because some problems about Python multiprocessing on Windows, so can you give me some suggestions about this problem?

Thank you so much.
